project.teaser: The main aim of the SIRENE proposal is to support the growth of social innovation ecosystems delivering eco-friendly and sustainable community-based services for SHAFE (Smart Healthy Age-Friendly Environments) implementation in Europe, by providing a workable framework for...
project.objective: The main aim of the SIRENE proposal is to support the growth of social innovation ecosystems delivering eco-friendly and sustainable community-based services for SHAFE (Smart Healthy Age-Friendly Environments) implementation in Europe, by providing a workable framework for investment and the broad adoption of high-quality smart living solutions, combining the housing sector and ICT infrastructure. There have been several initiatives and previous CSAs aiming to promote innovation and support stakeholders to increase investments in relevant societal areas, often providing support measures to different actors such as webinars, trainings, workshops, twinnings. However, their impact usually runs shorter than desirable in the mid- and long-term. SIRENE identifies a diverse approach: connect stakeholders by having them working together towards a Social Innovation framework and supporting tools, claiming that this joint collaborative and co-creative work will: Increase awareness of innovation actors on social innovation concepts, methods and he skills to leverage them. Make social entrepreneurs aware of potential business opportunities, funding and investment around SHAFE. Create alliances and synergies between different stakeholders within ecosystems and between ecosystems. Ensure that business actors have access to social innovation and entrepreneurial knowledge. Unleash the potential of social innovation ecosystems on SHAFE. The desired impact of the SIRENE proposal is to improve the wellbeing and housing conditions of the European population by empowering social and private entrepreneurs. SIRENE leverages on the networks and outcomes of the SHAFE Network and the COST Action19136 NET4Age-Friendly (SHINE and AFE coordination) the ECTP and Homes4Life (Tecnalia), the Thematic Inovation Ecosystem on Housing and Health (ECHA and ISRAA), as well as the European Reference Framework on Smart Age-Friendly Housing, the Green Deal and H2020/HE ICT funded projects.
project.title: Social Innovation Responsive Environments NETwork
project.keywords: market-creating innovation, entrepreneurship, inclusive environments, innovation ecosystems

article.title: Connecting the drivers of social innovation

result.title: Report on investment monitoring and stakeholders survey
result.description: IThis report will showcase the business models and scaling-up strategies within the SIRENE ecosystem, including also the results of a structured survey on investments.

result.title: Good Practices Blueprint
result.description: The Blueprint will be the key element with the cloud-based data repository to support the development of the proof of concept of a user-oriented, clear and accessible European social innovation framework for responsive, smart age-friendly living environments.

result.title: Sustainability Plan and SIRENE future activities
result.description: This report will present the partner initiatives to maximize the sustainability of the results of SIRENE, including the outcomes of the CANVAS or PESTLE analysis and future networking actions foreseen.

result.title: SIRENE Hub
result.description: This deliverable consists of an online Hub with an interactive design of the toolkit for the implementation of the Social innovation framework and respective tools. The Hub will be available in a demo version of the structure at M12 and be definitely launched at M24.

result.title: Report on liaising activities and growth of the International Stakeholder Community
result.description: This deliverable will report on all activities related to the cross-initiatives' engagement, concertation and liaison activities with other projects and pertinent initiatives to SIRENE and will include a Policy Brief to be further used.

result.title: SIRENE: A Social Innovation Framework for Regional Innovation and Entrepreneurship Ecosystems

details.authors: Dantas, C., Cabrita, M., Machado, N., Van Staalduinen, W., Zanutto, O., & Georgoulis, D.
details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the 31st Congresso of Associação Portuguesa para o Desenvolvimento Regional. Leiria, Portugal

result.title: Social Innovation framework
result.description: This report aims to deliver the Social Innovation Framework, developed through the Experts’ Hub and the ecosystems participation. A first draft of the SI framework will be circulated within the consortium at M12. From M13 till M18 a second draft will be developed to be further assessed and validated until M20 and then finalised by M22, submitted through D1.3.

result.title: Dynamic transnational inter-ecosystem framework for smart and inclusive age-friendly environments: The Transnational Local-Sphere Model

details.authors: Dieuwertje van Boekel, Miriam Cabrita, Wilhelmina van Staalduinen, Maria do Rosrio Cabrita, Francesca Masiero, Silvia Urra Uriarte, Dimitris Georgoulis, Carina Dantas

result.title: Report on capacity building and learning exchange activities
result.description: This deliverable reports on the short training webinars that will occur within the TIE (ECHA and ISRAA), as well as in colaboration with the NET4 network,including also the Short-Term Scientific Missions, Virtual Mobility Grants and Training Schools developed within this scope.

result.title: Report on the Ecosystems and Experts Hub pathway
result.description: This report douments the creation and set-up of the ecosystems, including also the list of participating organisations in each and a summary of the activities they enrolled towards their maturity as networks.

result.title: Video report of the SIRENE Roadshow
result.description: This video will provide an engaging report on SIRENE's roadshow, including its several activities, stakeholders interviews and the final achievements showcased.

result.title: Report on SoTA for SI ecosystems on SHAFE
result.description: This report will present knowledgebased information on the stateoftheart solutions and good practices of innovative approaches standards and guidelines for responsive smart agefriendly living environments and the current best practices and SoTA knowledge on social innovation methods practices and their inclusion in innovation ecosystems

result.title: Cloud-based data repository
result.description: The cloud-based data repository will be composed of a comprehensive summary and analysis of gaps, literature and practices contents and related feedback as well as up to date real linkages to experts, collaborators and stakeholders actively involved in the co-creation of the framework. The repository will be finally delivered at M24 but at M12 an intermmediate version will be available for internal discussion and refinements.

result.description: Report on the activities developed through:1. Science Cafes2. Videopills3. Info packages

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
